projects.name: Pixelization Program
projects.description: A program that accepts images of any resolution and outputs the same image in the art style of pixel art, with a specified output resolution and limited palette.  This is accomplished using an interleaved combination of the SLIC superpixel algorithm and the Mass Constrained Deterministic Annealing algorithm.

projects.name: Web Comic Reader
projects.description: An application that takes a folder of webcomic pages and displays them in a viewer.  Also has scraping capabilities for offline viewing.

projects.name: SSeawolf Script
projects.description: Program written to interpret and compile a programming language known as SSeawolf Script.

projects.name: Pac-Man Searchers
projects.description: Automated Pac-Man programs that allow Pac-Man to chase ghosts and eat pellets by following various AI techniques including but not limited to Bayes' Nets, adversarial searches, and graph based searches.

projects.name: Computer Processing Unit
projects.description: A processor in a HDL with 5+ stage pipelining, direct and set associated caches, branch prediction abilities, and is capable of running simple assembly programs.

projects.name: I-Programming
projects.language: Java, HTML, CSS, Javascript, and SQL, using Bootstrap, Maven, and Spring MVC
projects.description: A web application designed to teach users how to program, where they can also create and share courses.

projects.name: Packet Sniffer
projects.description: This program captures network traffic, parses it to determine the packet format, and displays it back in a user-friendly format.  It is also capable of searching the captured packets using regular expressions, filtering out types of packets, and reconstructing DNS queries.

projects.name: Localization Using Radio Fingerprints
projects.description: An application that is capable of determining the approximate location of a variable number of radio towers in a grid given the fingerprint vectors of each cell in the grid using a Gaussian Naive Bayes-based algorithm.

projects.name: Web Messenger App
projects.description: This consists of both a client and server program, and allows two users to send messages to one another in real-time.  Users login with a username and password, stored using a SQLite database on the server, and can then send messages to any other user currently online.

projects.name: Shell Program
projects.description: A shell program that is written to mimic the Bash program in UNIX operating systems.

projects.name: Memory Allocator
projects.description: A dynamic memory allocator written from scratch to manage a given chunk of memory.  This allocator uses an explicit freelist to manage allocations, and supports both first and next block placement.

projects.name: Lawn Mower Game
projects.description: This is an interactive game in where the user attempts to mow a lawn.

projects.name: Sudoku Solver
projects.description: Recursively solves a sudoku puzzle, provided as a string input.

projects.name: Course Site Builder
projects.description: A program to automate the process of recreating a course webpage.
